newsitem.title: FRANCE: Minitel sex-talk manager on trial for pimping.
newsitem.headline: Minitel sex-talk manager on trial for pimping.

text.p: A state prosecutor asked a French court on Thursday to impose a heavy fine on a sex-talk service on the Minitel home electronic directory which is facing charges of pimping.

Prosecutor Bernard Pages asked for a five million franc ($860,000) for the Eurifnacom firm, which owns the service called "3615 Aline", and 300,000 francs ($52,000) for Valery Sourieau, manager of the service, which allows people to converse through the Minitel network while remaining anonymous.
He said the service was used for making dates with prostitutes.
It is only the second time Minitel sex-talk services, dozens of which operate in France and are often advertised with sexually suggestive posters, have been the object of pimping accusations.
However, the prosecutor's office declined to file charges against telephone company France Telecom, which charges a fee for the communication, in the name of procedural efficiency.
Eurifnacom, which employs a dozen people at the minimum legal wage earns 23 million francs ($4 million) in annual sales for the service.
Soulieau explained to the court that the firm's employees had no access to the conversations, which were protected by privacy laws.
Pages argued that minitel conversations could not be compared to a phone communication because they put in contact "an unknown person with obscure network of correspondents".
